Today, his words are on the hearts of people across the country who are demanding that our nation uproot the interconnected web of systemic racism & injustice. As Dr. King said, we can’t “overlook the urgency of the moment”.
 
We must work together to fulfill MLK's dream.

1299539397294030851.text: 57 years ago, Dr. King stood on the Lincoln Memorial to speak about his dream of equality and justice for everyone in our country. MLK’s words not only moved the nation, but his actions helped change the country when the Civil Rights Act & Voting Rights Act were signed into law.

1299509165589757956.text: Our justice system failed Emmett and his family. As we remember and honor his life and legacy today, we must continue to fight the injustices that are taking place across the country.

1299509066813841418.text: Like so many of the young black men and women who have been killed in the name of hate & racism, Emmett Till deserved to have the opportunity to pursue his dreams and live a full life.
